info.long_name: Minutes to Nearest Day Care
info.short_description: Time (minutes) to drive to the nearest day care provider.
info.long_description: Time (minutes) to drive to the nearest day care provider of any type.
info.statement: It takes {value} to drive to the nearest day care provider in {region_name}.

info.long_name: Day Care Capacity
info.short_description: Summed capacity (seats) of all day care providers within the region.
info.long_description: Summed capacity (seats) of all day care providers within the region.
info.statement: There are {value} daycare seats in {region_name}.

info.long_name: Day Care Seats Per 1k Children Under 15
info.short_description: Number of day care seats per 1,000 children under 15 years of age.
info.long_description: Number of day care seats per 1,000 children under 15 years of age, as calculated within floating catchment areas. Catchment area ratios are based on population under 15 within block groups (as estimated in the American Community Survey), day care capacity (as reported by the Virginia Department of Social Services), and travel times between block group centroids and day care locations (as calculated with the Open Source Routing Machine). Catchment areas are weighted by travel time with a Gaussian function with scale of 18, which are normalized for each consumer.
info.statement: There are {value} day care seats per 1,000 children under 15 in {region_name}.

info.long_name: Day Care Seats Per 1k Children Ages 5 to 14
info.short_description: Number of day care seats per 1,000 children between 5 and 14 years of age.
info.long_description: Number of day care seats per 1,000 children between 5 and 14 years of age, as calculated within floating catchment areas. Catchment area ratios are based on population 5 and 14 within block groups (as estimated in the American Community Survey), day care capacity (as reported by the Virginia Department of Social Services), and travel times between block group centroids and day care locations (as calculated with the Open Source Routing Machine). Catchment areas are weighted by travel time with a Gaussian function with scale of 18, which are normalized for each consumer.
info.statement: There are {value} day care seats per 1,000 children between 5 and 14 in {region_name}.

info.long_name: Day Care Seats Per 1k Children Under 10
info.short_description: Number of day care seats per 1,000 children under 10 years of age.
info.long_description: Number of day care seats per 1,000 children under 10 years of age, as calculated within floating catchment areas. Catchment area ratios are based on population under 10 within block groups (as estimated in the American Community Survey), day care capacity (as reported by the Virginia Department of Social Services), and travel times between block group centroids and day care locations (as calculated with the Open Source Routing Machine). Catchment areas are weighted by travel time with a Gaussian function with scale of 18, which are normalized for each consumer.
info.statement: There are {value} day care seats per 1,000 children under 10 in {region_name}.

info.long_name: Estimated Number of People With Any Postsecondary Education
info.short_description: Number of people who reported any postsecondary education.
info.long_description: Number of people who reported any postsecondary education, according to the U.S. Census American Community Survey 5-year estimates.
info.statement: In {region_name}, {value} report any postsecondary education.

sources.name: U.S. Census, American Community Survey
sources.location: 5-Year estimates, table B06009, via the API

info.long_name: Estimated Percentage of Population With Any Postsecondary Education
info.short_description: Percentage of the population who reported any postsecondary education.
info.long_description: Percentage of the population who reported any postsecondary education, according to the U.S. Census American Community Survey 5-year estimates.
info.statement: {value} of those in {region_name} report any postsecondary education.

sources.name: U.S. Census, American Community Survey
sources.location: 5-Year estimates, table B06009, via the API

info.long_name: drive time to nearest 2-year school
info.short_description: Drive time to the nearest 2-year schools.
info.long_description: Minimal drive time to a school authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates from the Census block group centroid, as calculated by the Open Source Routing Machine in 2022. School locations are from the National Center for Education Statistics. All distances are calculated at the block group level, then averaged up to higher-level geographies.
info.statement: It takes {value} to drive to a 2-year school from {region_name}'s block group centroids on average.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

info.long_name: drive time to nearest <2-year school
info.short_description: Drive time to the nearest <2-year schools.
info.long_description: Minimal drive time to a schools authorized to award certificates that are typically obtained in less than 2 years from the Census block group centroid, as calculated by the Open Source Routing Machine in 2022. School locations are from the National Center for Education Statistics. All distances are calculated at the block group level, then averaged up to higher-level geographies.
info.statement: It takes {value} to drive to a <2-year school from {region_name}'s block group centroids on average.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

info.long_name: 2-year schools per 100k people over 14
info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools per 100k people over 14.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {region_name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

info.long_name: <2-year schools per 100k people over 14
info.short_description: Number of <2-year schools per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award certificates that are typically obtained in less than 2 years per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) <2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} <2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {region_name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

info.long_name: 2-year biomedical programs per 100k people over 14
info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools with biomedical programs per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or less than 2-year or longer certificates with biomedical programs (any with Classification of Institutional Programs [CIP] codes starting with 26) per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools with any degrees conferred in the given year with a CIP code starting with 26, as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools with a biomedical program per 100k people over 14 in {region_name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics and Completions files

info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools with a computer science program per 100k people over 14 in {region_name}.

info.statement: In {region_name}, {value} report any postsecondary education.

sources.name: U.S. Census, American Community Survey
sources.location: 5-Year estimates, table B06009, via the API

info.long_name: Estimated Percentage of Population With Any Postsecondary Education
info.short_description: Percentage of the population who reported any postsecondary education.
info.long_description: Percentage of the population who reported any postsecondary education, according to the U.S. Census American Community Survey 5-year estimates.
info.statement: {value} of those in {region_name} report any postsecondary education.

sources.name: U.S. Census, American Community Survey
sources.location: 5-Year estimates, table B06009, via the API

info.long_name: drive time to nearest 2-year school
info.short_description: Drive time to the nearest 2-year schools.
info.long_description: Minimal drive time to a school authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates from the Census block group centroid, as calculated by the Open Source Routing Machine in 2022. School locations are from the National Center for Education Statistics. All distances are calculated at the block group level, then averaged up to higher-level geographies.
info.statement: It takes {value} to drive to a 2-year school from {region_name}'s block group centroids on average.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

info.long_name: drive time to nearest <2-year school
info.short_description: Drive time to the nearest <2-year schools.
info.long_description: Minimal drive time to a schools authorized to award certificates that are typically obtained in less than 2 years from the Census block group centroid, as calculated by the Open Source Routing Machine in 2022. School locations are from the National Center for Education Statistics. All distances are calculated at the block group level, then averaged up to higher-level geographies.
info.statement: It takes {value} to drive to a <2-year school from {region_name}'s block group centroids on average.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

info.long_name: 2-year schools per 100k people over 14
info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools per 100k people over 14.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {region_name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

info.long_name: <2-year schools per 100k people over 14
info.short_description: Number of <2-year schools per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award certificates that are typically obtained in less than 2 years per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) <2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} <2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {region_name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

info.long_name: 2-year biomedical programs per 100k people over 14
info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools with biomedical programs per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or less than 2-year or longer certificates with biomedical programs (any with Classification of Institutional Programs [CIP] codes starting with 26) per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools with any degrees conferred in the given year with a CIP code starting with 26, as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools with a biomedical program per 100k people over 14 in {region_name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics and Completions files

info.long_name: Minutes to Nearest Day Care
info.short_description: Time (minutes) to drive to the nearest day care provider.
info.long_description: Time (minutes) to drive to the nearest day care provider of any type.
info.statement: It takes {value} to drive to the nearest day care provider in {region_name}.

info.long_name: Day Care Capacity
info.short_description: Summed capacity (seats) of all day care providers within the region.
info.long_description: Summed capacity (seats) of all day care providers within the region.
info.statement: There are {value} daycare seats in {region_name}.

info.long_name: Day Care Seats Per 1k Children Under 15
info.short_description: Number of day care seats per 1,000 children under 15 years of age.
info.long_description: Number of day care seats per 1,000 children under 15 years of age, as calculated within floating catchment areas. Catchment area ratios are based on population under 15 within block groups (as estimated in the American Community Survey), day care capacity (as reported by the Virginia Department of Social Services), and travel times between block group centroids and day care locations (as calculated with the Open Source Routing Machine). Catchment areas are weighted by travel time with a Gaussian function with scale of 18, which are normalized for each consumer.
info.statement: There are {value} day care seats per 1,000 children under 15 in {region_name}.

info.long_name: Day Care Seats Per 1k Children Ages 5 to 14
info.short_description: Number of day care seats per 1,000 children between 5 and 14 years of age.
info.long_description: Number of day care seats per 1,000 children between 5 and 14 years of age, as calculated within floating catchment areas. Catchment area ratios are based on population 5 and 14 within block groups (as estimated in the American Community Survey), day care capacity (as reported by the Virginia Department of Social Services), and travel times between block group centroids and day care locations (as calculated with the Open Source Routing Machine). Catchment areas are weighted by travel time with a Gaussian function with scale of 18, which are normalized for each consumer.
info.statement: There are {value} day care seats per 1,000 children between 5 and 14 in {region_name}.

info.long_name: Day Care Seats Per 1k Children Under 10
info.short_description: Number of day care seats per 1,000 children under 10 years of age.
info.long_description: Number of day care seats per 1,000 children under 10 years of age, as calculated within floating catchment areas. Catchment area ratios are based on population under 10 within block groups (as estimated in the American Community Survey), day care capacity (as reported by the Virginia Department of Social Services), and travel times between block group centroids and day care locations (as calculated with the Open Source Routing Machine). Catchment areas are weighted by travel time with a Gaussian function with scale of 18, which are normalized for each consumer.
info.statement: There are {value} day care seats per 1,000 children under 10 in {region_name}.

info.long_name: <2-year schools per 100k people over 14
info.short_description: Number of <2-year schools per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award certificates that are typically obtained in less than 2 years per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) <2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} <2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {region_name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

info.long_name: 2-year biomedical programs per 100k people over 14
info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools with biomedical programs per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or less than 2-year or longer certificates with biomedical programs (any with Classification of Institutional Programs [CIP] codes starting with 26) per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools with any degrees conferred in the given year with a CIP code starting with 26, as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools with a biomedical program per 100k people over 14 in {region_name}.

info.long_name: Mean percentage of 3rd graders passing reading test
info.short_description: Mean percentage of 3rd grade population passing reading test for schools in the region
info.long_description: Mean percentage of 3rd grade population passing reading test. The median is calculated across schools in the region.
info.statement: In most regions, {value} of 3rd graders pass reading in {region_name}.
